data.title: User:Nyargleblargle/Frisk
data.meta_description: Frisk would be a playable character in Super Smash Bros. Dream if that were an actual thing. They were confirmed by Nyargleblargle on May 22nd, 2016. Frisk is one of two characters to be rendered entirely in 2D and has Chara as an alternate costume.
data.text: Move Name Damage Description Neutral attack Tough Glove 2% per hit Frisk punches the opponent up to four times depending on how rapidly the attack button is tapped. Dash attack Stick 6% Frisk thrusts a stick ahead. Up tilt Worn Dagger 9% Frisk swings the Worn Dagger above themselves. Forward tilt Torn Notebook 5% Frisk swings the Torn Notebook in front of themselves. Weak and lacks range, but a solid combo starter. Down tilt — 3% Frisk crouches and pokes in front of themselves with a stick. Up smash Real Knife 20% Frisk swings the Real Knife above themselves. Forward smash Burnt Pan 12% Frisk whacks the opponent with a pan. Virtually identical to Peach's forward smash in animation. Down smash Old Tutu 1% (hits 1-4), 10% (hit 5) Frisk twirls around in the Old Tutu. Neutral aerial Yellow 3% A small yellow projectile launches in front of Frisk. Forward aerial Toy Knife 10% Frisk slices with the Toy Knife. Back aerial — 6% Frisk whacks behind themselves with an umbrella. Up aerial — 3% Frisk strikes a pose. Can combo into itself. Down aerial Ballet Shoes 2% per hit Frisk stomps with the Ballet Shoes. Grab — — Frisk reaches out in front of themselves. Pummel — 1% Frisk "shakes their hand." Unarguably the worst pummel in the game, as it deals little damage and is slow. Forward throw — 10% Frisk lets go of the opponent and kicks a snowball at them. Back throw — 12% Frisk lets go of the opponent and kicks a snowball at them. Despite having a similar animation to forward throw, this attack is a far better KO move but makes it more difficult to rack up damage. Up throw — 8% Frisk flips a switch up where the opponent is, sending the opponent upwards. Down throw Ballet Shoes 3% (hits 1-2), 4%, (hit 3) Frisk tosses the opponent downwards and stomps on them three times. Neutral special Act — If an opponent comes within very close range, Frisk will talk to them, producing a text box with unique dialogue for each opponent and lowering their offense and defense. If used enough times on the same opponent, they can automatically lose a stock once Spare is used, but it leaves Frisk vulnerable from behind. Side special Empty Gun 1% (bad timing), 3.5% (perfect timing) Frisk fires up to four bullets from a pistol, depending on how many times the special button is pressed. Deals far more damage if the button is pressed with perfect rhythm. Up special Vent — Frisk disappears and reappears just below a vent far above the initial point. Effectively a simple third jump.
